abstract: Widespread trading practices are creating a headache for regulators who are trying to devise rules to prevent another financial crisis.
snippet: Widespread trading practices are creating a headache for regulators who are trying to devise rules to prevent another financial crisis.
lead_paragraph: When JPMorgan Chase revealed its $2 billion loss last week, it looked as though the big Wall Street banks were up to their old tricks, using their government-backed funds to make risky trades in a misguided effort to improve their profits.

headline.main: Banks Tread a Fine Line in Trading

lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase Executive to Resign After Trading Loss  |  The huge loss at JPMorgan Chase has claimed three top traders in the bank’s London office, including Ina Drew, one of the most senior women on Wall Street, The New York Times reports.

abstract: Matthew E. Zames, a co-head of JPMorgan Chase’s global fixed-income group and head of capital markets in its mortgage division, will succeed Ina Drew as chief investment officer.
snippet: Matthew E. Zames, a co-head of JPMorgan Chase’s global fixed-income group and head of capital markets in its mortgage division, will succeed Ina Drew as chief investment officer.
lead_paragraph: Ina Drew, the chief investment officer who presided over JPMorgan Chase‘s $2 billion trading loss announced last week, has retired from the bank, according to a statement on Monday.

headline.main: JPMorgan Names C.I.O. to Succeed Ina Drew

abstract: JPMorgan's losses cause the ouster of a trusted deputy | The battle for Yahoo's board | Student loans hobble a generation of graduates.
snippet: JPMorgan's losses cause the ouster of a trusted deputy | The battle for Yahoo's board | Student loans hobble a generation of graduates.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan's losses cause the ouster of a trusted deputy | The battle for Yahoo's board | Student loans hobble a generation of graduates.

byline.original: Mac William Bishop, Nadia Sussman, Pedro Rosado, Channon Hodge and Jeremy Beiler

abstract: Shares in the nation’s biggest banks declined on Monday, as investors seemed to be worried about the continued fallout from JPMorgan Chase’s $2 billion trading loss.
snippet: Shares in the nation’s biggest banks declined on Monday, as investors seemed to be worried about the continued fallout from JPMorgan Chase’s $2 billion trading loss.
lead_paragraph: Shares in the nation’s biggest banks declined again on Monday, as investors still appeared worried about the continued fallout from JPMorgan Chase’s $2 billion trading loss.

headline.main: Bank Stocks Down Again as JPMorgan’s Woes Reverberate

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Matthew E. Zames, co-head of JPMorgan Chase’s global fixed-income group who some see as a potential heir to Jamie Dimon, has seen trading blowups before.
snippet: Matthew E. Zames, co-head of JPMorgan Chase’s global fixed-income group who some see as a potential heir to Jamie Dimon, has seen trading blowups before.
lead_paragraph: Matthew E. Zames, who will take over for Ina Drew as the chief investment officer of JPMorgan Chase in the wake of a $2 billion trading loss, has a long relationship with risk.

headline.main: Ina Drew’s Successor at JPMorgan Has a Long History With Risk

abstract: With Ina Drew and two JPMorgan Chase traders leaving in the wake of the trading loss, the question is whether JPMorgan will invoke its newly implemented clawback policy to penalize these executives.
snippet: With Ina Drew and two JPMorgan Chase traders leaving in the wake of the trading loss, the question is whether JPMorgan will invoke its newly implemented clawback policy to penalize these executives.
lead_paragraph: Ina Drew and two JPMorgan Chase traders are leaving in the wake of the bank’s $2 billion trading loss, and others could follow.

headline.main: After $2 Billion Loss, Will JPMorgan Move to Claw Back Pay?

abstract: Any S.E.C. investigation would not focus as much on the decision to use complex derivatives or whether the bank took on too much risk, but on when Jamie Dimon and the bank’s management knew about the losses, and what they said to investors about the problem.
snippet: Any S.E.C. investigation would not focus as much on the decision to use complex derivatives or whether the bank took on too much risk, but on when Jamie Dimon and the bank’s management knew about the losses, and what they said to investors about t...
lead_paragraph: Senator Everett Dirksen is reputed to have once said, “A billion here, a billion there, and pretty soon you’re talking real money.” JPMorgan Chase disclosed a $2 billion loss on a complex hedging strategy indeed qualifies as an object lesson for that axiom.

headline.main: JPMorgan’s Loss: Illegal, or Just Bad Judgment?

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

abstract: Matthew E. Zames, the JPMorgan executive who was tapped on Monday to replace the outgoing chief investment officer, Ina Drew, announced several top leadership changes in the unit on Monday afternoon.
snippet: Matthew E. Zames, the JPMorgan executive who was tapped on Monday to replace the outgoing chief investment officer, Ina Drew, announced several top leadership changes in the unit on Monday afternoon.
lead_paragraph: Several days after announcing a $2 billion loss in its chief investment office, JPMorgan Chase is clearing house.

headline.main: After $2 Billion Loss, JPMorgan Reshuffles Trading Group
